data.title: Michael Jackson Death House Finally Sells For $18.1 Million
data.meta_description: The over-the-top Holmby Hills mansion that Michael Jackson was renting when he died has finally sold for way under asking--according to the Wall Street Journal, sources say the buyer is "Steven...
data.text:
The over-the-top Holmby Hills mansion that Michael Jackson was renting when he died has finally sold for way under asking--according to the Wall Street Journal, sources say the buyer is "Steven Mayer, a senior managing director of private investment firm Cerberus Capital Management." Mayer bought the seven-bedroom house from Ed Hardy owner Hubert Guez and Roxanne Guez--they originally listed the house in 2008 asking $38 million, then rented the house to Jackson in 2009 for $100,000. In 2011, they sued a star maps-seller working down the street, saying she was scaring off potential buyers. Most recently they were asking $23.9 million. Megamansion developer Mohamed Hadid built the 17,171 square foot house in 2002 from a design by Richard Landry; the Guezes bought it in 2004 for $18.5 million. They sold to Mayer for $18.1 million.

· Former Michael Jackson Home Sells for $18.1 Million [WSJ]

· Michael Jackson's Last House Up For Sale For $23.9 Million [Curbed LA]

· 100 N Carolwood Dr. | Holmby Hills [The Agency]
